metadata.event: AI Search & Agentic Marketing Summit — February 2026
metadata.description: Playbook definitions for the weekly summit challenge. Each playbook contains the instruction text to be loaded into Atlas Brain, the agent namespace it runs under, and the MCP tools it calls.
metadata.notes: 28 playbooks covering all 5 days of the AI Search Summit challenge.

pre_work.description: Required setup before running any challenge playbooks

checklist.step: Create a SearchAtlas account or start a trial
Create a project in Atlas Brain
Install OTTO SEO on your website
Add integrations (GSC, GA4, GBP, Google Ads, Social Media)
Create and fill your Brand Vault
Connect an email address to Digital PR tools
Connect social media accounts to Social sharing tools
Add images to your Media Library

playbooks.name: Launch Your AI-Generated Website
playbooks.description: Uses Website Studio to generate and publish a complete AI-built website from the user's existing URL or from scratch.
playbooks.instruction:
Create and publish an AI-generated website using Website Studio.

Step 1 — Check Existing Projects
Use list_website_studio_projects to see if the user already has a Website Studio project. If one exists, use get_website_studio_project to review its current status before proceeding.

Step 2 — Determine Creation Mode
Ask the user which mode to use:
- free — build a new site from scratch using Brand Vault data
- clone — clone an existing website as-is
- clone_seo — clone with on-page SEO improvements applied automatically
- clone_ppc — clone optimized for paid traffic and conversion

Recommend clone_seo if the user has an existing website and wants SEO improvements baked in from day one.

Step 3 — Create the Project
Use create_project with the selected mode and the user's website URL (for clone modes) or brand information (for free mode). Wait for the generation to complete — this is an async task. Poll for status until the project is ready.

Step 4 — Review the Generated Site
Use get_website_studio_project to retrieve the project details. Present the user with:
- The generated site preview URL
- Pages created
- SEO improvements applied (for clone_seo mode)
- Key design decisions made

Step 5 — Publish
After the user reviews and approves, use publish_project to make the site live. Confirm the published URL and present it to the user.

Note: Do NOT publish without explicit user approval — always show the preview first.
expected_benefits: Generates a complete, SEO-optimized website in minutes
Applies on-page SEO improvements automatically in clone_seo mode
Establishes the digital home base needed for all other Day 1 tools
playbooks.sample_prompt: Create an AI-generated website for my business using my existing URL. Use clone_seo mode to improve the SEO while cloning.

playbooks.name: Build Your Brand Vault — Digital Identity Foundation
playbooks.description: Creates and fully populates a Brand Vault with company identity, authorship, social profiles, and knowledge graph data — the foundation all other tools draw from.
playbooks.instruction:
Create and populate a complete Brand Vault for the user's business.

Step 1 — Check for Existing Brand Vault
Use list_brand_vaults to see if a Brand Vault already exists. If one exists, use retrieve_brand_vault_details to assess completeness. If it's already fully populated, skip to Step 4.

Step 2 — Gather Required Information
Before creating, collect the following from the user:
- Business name and website URL
- Business description (2-3 sentences)
- Phone number and physical address
- Author name (the primary content author)
- Social media profile URLs (LinkedIn, Twitter/X, Instagram, Facebook)
- GBP URL (if local business)
- Logo URL or image

Explain why each field matters: Brand Vault data feeds directly into Content Genius, OTTO SEO, GBP, and Website Studio outputs.

Step 3 — Create the Brand Vault
Use create_brand_vault with the user's website URL and business name. Then:
- Use update_brand_vault_business_info to add contact details, address, and phone
- Use update_knowledge_graph to add the author name and social profile URLs
- Use upload_image if the user provides a logo file

Step 4 — Select Voice Profile
Use list_voice_profiles to show available writing tone options. Ask the user to select the voice that best matches their brand (e.g., professional, conversational, authoritative). Apply with update_brand_vault.

Step 5 — Verify Completeness
Use get_brand_vault_overview to confirm the knowledge base is populated (words, pages, images). Use get_brand_vault_business_info to do a final completeness check.

Present a summary of what was created and which tools will now benefit from this data.
expected_benefits: Establishes brand identity data that feeds every other SearchAtlas tool
Ensures Content Genius, OTTO SEO, and GBP produce brand-consistent outputs
Creates the authorship and E-E-A-T foundation for content authority
playbooks.sample_prompt: Create a Brand Vault for my business. Walk me through each field and help me fill it in completely.

playbooks.name: Connect and Optimize Your Google Business Profile
playbooks.description: Connects the user's GBP to SearchAtlas, verifies profile completeness, and applies AI-generated optimization recommendations.
playbooks.instruction:
Connect, verify, and optimize the user's Google Business Profile.

Step 1 — Check Connected Locations
Use list_locations to see if any GBP locations are already connected. If locations exist, use get_location to review each one's completeness. If none are connected, use all_available_locations to discover GBP listings linked to the user's Google account, then use manage_connections to connect them.

Step 2 — Audit Profile Completeness
For each connected location, use get_location to check:
- Business name, address, phone, and website
- Business hours (including special hours)
- Business categories (primary + secondary)
- Business description
- Services and attributes populated
- Photos uploaded
- GBP URL

Present a completeness score and highlight any critical gaps.

Step 3 — Fill Gaps
For missing or incomplete fields:
- Use update_location for name, address, phone, website, and hours
- Use bulk_upsert_standard_services and bulk_upsert_custom_services to populate services
- Use bulk_upsert_attributes for business attributes (Wi-Fi, parking, accessibility, etc.)
- Use suggest_description to generate an AI-optimized business description

Always confirm changes with the user before applying.

Step 4 — Apply AI Recommendations
Use generate_recommendations to get AI-powered optimization suggestions for the profile. Review each recommendation with the user. Use apply_recommendation for approved changes or bulk_apply_recommendations if the user approves all.

Step 5 — Deploy and Verify
Use deploy_location to push all approved changes live to Google. Use bulk_refresh_stats to update performance metrics. Present a summary of what was optimized.
expected_benefits: Connects GBP to SearchAtlas for ongoing AI-powered management
Fills profile gaps that suppress local search visibility
Applies AI optimization recommendations to improve local pack rankings
playbooks.sample_prompt: Connect my Google Business Profile and optimize it. Check what's missing and apply AI recommendations.

playbooks.name: Set Up Local SEO Heatmap Tracking
playbooks.description: Creates a local SEO business and configures heatmap rank tracking grids to baseline current local search visibility before the 5-day challenge begins.
playbooks.instruction:
Set up local SEO heatmap tracking to establish a visibility baseline.

Step 1 — Check Existing Businesses
Use list_businesses to see if a local SEO business profile already exists. If one exists, use get_business to review its configuration. If none exists, proceed to Step 2.

Step 2 — Create Local SEO Business
Use extract_business_details with the user's website URL to auto-populate business information. Review the extracted data with the user for accuracy. Use create_business to create the local SEO profile with:
- Business name and website
- Primary address
- Phone number
- Business category

Step 3 — Set Up Heatmap Grid
Ask the user for:
- 1-3 primary keywords they want to track locally (e.g., "plumber near me", "best Italian restaurant")
- Their primary service area (city or radius in miles)

Use setup_grid for each keyword with appropriate grid settings:
- Grid size: 7x7 (49 points) for a balanced coverage/speed tradeoff
- Radius: match to the user's actual service area
- Set the target business correctly

Step 4 — Run Initial Rank Check
Use refresh_grid to trigger an initial rank scan for each grid. Poll until complete. Use get_rank and get_heatmap_preview to retrieve results.

Step 5 — Present the Baseline
Show the user their current local visibility heatmap for each keyword:
- Average rank across the grid
- Best and worst-performing areas
- Where they appear in the local pack vs where they don't

Explain that this baseline will be used to measure improvement after deploying the GBP and citation playbooks on Days 2 and 3.
expected_benefits: Establishes a local rank baseline before optimizations begin
Visualizes geographic gaps in local search visibility
Enables measurable before/after comparison after Day 3 citation and GBP work
playbooks.sample_prompt: Set up local SEO heatmap tracking for my business. I want to track my top 3 keywords and see where I rank in my service area.

playbooks.name: Review & Complete Brand Vault
playbooks.description: Reviews the current Brand Vault for completeness and ensures all fields are populated for optimal content tool outputs.
playbooks.instruction:
Review the current brand vault for the user's active project.

Step 1 — Retrieve the Brand Vault
Use list_brand_vaults to find the user's Brand Vault. Then use retrieve_brand_vault_details to get the full configuration, get_brand_vault_business_info to check company info, and get_knowledge_graph to review authorship and social profiles.

Step 2 — Audit Completeness
Check that all of the following fields are populated:
- Company name and description
- Website URL
- Phone number and address
- Logo and photos
- Author name
- Social media profile URLs
- GBP URL (if this is a local business)
- Voice profile selection
- Top pages identified

Use get_brand_vault_overview to check the overall knowledge base status (words, pages, images, videos).

Step 3 — Report Findings
Present a clear summary of what is filled in vs what is missing. For each missing field, explain why it matters for content quality.

Step 4 — Fix Missing Fields
If the user provides missing information, use update_brand_vault_business_info for contact/address data, update_knowledge_graph for authorship and social profiles, and update_brand_vault for general settings. Use upload_image if logo or photos need to be added.

Always ask the user before making changes.
expected_benefits: Ensures Brand Vault is fully populated for maximum content quality
Identifies missing data fields that impact content generation
Improves outputs across all content tools that pull from Brand Vault
playbooks.sample_prompt: Review the current brand vault for my project. Let me know if anything is missing or if there's any additional information I can add to get better outputs out of the content tools

playbooks.name: Build Topical Map Content Strategy
playbooks.description: Creates a topical authority map for a target keyword to generate a structured content cluster strategy.
playbooks.instruction:
Create a topical authority map for the user's website.

Step 1 — Identify the Target Keyword
Ask the user for a single high-intent keyword that represents their core service or product. This should be a competitive head term they want to build authority around.

Step 2 — Generate the Topical Map
Use create_topical_map with the user's keyword. Target the home page as the pillar page. Generate 100 topic clusters that map the full topical space around the keyword.

Step 3 — Review the Map
Once generated, use search_topical_maps to retrieve the completed map. Present the topic clusters organized by:
- Pillar content (main keyword)
- Supporting clusters (subtopics)
- Long-tail variations

Step 4 — Supplement with Keyword Data
Use create_keyword_research_project to build a keyword list from the top topics. Use get_serp_overview to check competition levels and search volume for the most important clusters.

Step 5 — Present the Strategy
Deliver a prioritized content plan showing which topics to create first based on search volume, competition, and topical relevance. Recommend starting with the pillar page and working outward to supporting content.
expected_benefits: Creates a structured 100-topic content plan from a single seed keyword
Maps the full topical authority space for the user's niche
Prioritizes content creation by search volume and competition
playbooks.sample_prompt: Create a topical map for my website using a single high intent keyword. Target my home page as the starting point. Generate 100 topics

playbooks.name: Increase Organic Traffic with Quality Content
playbooks.description: Creates an end-to-end content strategy for Google Search using topical maps, DKN nodes, and AI content generation.
playbooks.instruction:
Build a complete content strategy to increase organic traffic.

Step 1 — Analyze Existing Content
Use list_recent_articles to see what content already exists. Use search_topical_maps to check for existing topical maps. Use get_dkn_overview_metrics and list_dkn_nodes to understand the current Domain Knowledge Network.

Step 2 — Identify Content Gaps
Compare existing articles against DKN nodes and topical map topics. Use topic_suggestions to generate AI-powered topic ideas for uncovered areas. Focus on high-intent keywords the user's site should rank for but currently doesn't.

Step 3 — Generate Content
For each priority topic, generate an article using the 4-step workflow:
1. create_content_instance — set up the page with title and target keywords
2. start_information_retrieval — research the keyword and SERP landscape
3. start_headings_outline — generate an optimized heading structure
4. generate_complete_article — produce the full article

Poll poll_information_retrieval and poll_headings_outline between steps to wait for completion.

Alternatively, use auto_generate_article for faster single-call generation.

Step 4 — Quality Check
Run run_content_grader on each generated article to get a semantic SEO score. Use insert_article_links to add internal linking suggestions. Target a content score of 80+ before publishing.

Step 5 — Organize and Publish
Use manage_article_keywords to ensure proper keyword targeting. Present the complete content plan to the user with articles organized by topic cluster.

Use ask_brand_vault throughout to pull brand-specific context into each piece of content.
expected_benefits: Creates pillar pages and supporting articles that establish topical authority
Compounds rankings over time through internal linking
Fills content gaps identified through DKN and topical map analysis

playbooks.name: Connect GSC and Analyze Search Performance
playbooks.description: Connects Google Search Console and runs a keyword and page performance analysis to identify quick-win optimization opportunities.
playbooks.instruction:
Connect Google Search Console and run a full performance analysis.

Step 1 — Verify GSC Connection
Check if GSC is already connected by attempting to use GSC_Performance_Tool. If the connection is not active, direct the user to connect GSC at https://dashboard.searchatlas.com/settings?active_section=integration. Wait for the user to confirm connection before proceeding.

Step 2 — Keyword Performance Analysis
Use get_keyword_performance to pull the top-performing search queries. Filter for:
- High-impression / low-click-through-rate keywords (CTR optimization opportunities)
- Keywords ranking in positions 4-20 (quick-win ranking improvement candidates)
- Branded vs non-branded query breakdown

Present the top 20 queries by impression volume with their current position and CTR.

Step 3 — Page Performance Analysis
Use get_page_performance to identify:
- Top landing pages by clicks
- Pages with high impressions but low CTR (title/meta description optimization needed)
- Pages that have dropped in ranking recently

Highlight the top 5 pages that would benefit most from OTTO SEO optimization (connect to Day 2 Playbook 6 — On-Page SEO).

Step 4 — Performance Comparison
Use compare_performance to show trends over the last 28 days vs the prior 28-day period:
- Overall click and impression trend
- Biggest keyword movers (up and down)
- Pages gaining and losing visibility

Step 5 — Create Site Events
Use GSC_Site_Events_Tool to create site events for key milestones (e.g., OTTO deployment date, content publish dates). This enables performance attribution when reviewing results on Day 5.

Deliver a 1-page performance summary with: top keywords, top pages, CTR opportunities, and a ranked list of pages to optimize first.
expected_benefits: Reveals which keywords and pages are closest to ranking improvements
Identifies CTR optimization opportunities in existing Google rankings
Creates performance baselines with event markers for Day 5 attribution
playbooks.sample_prompt: Connect my Google Search Console and give me a full performance analysis. Find my quick-win keywords and show me which pages need CTR optimization.

playbooks.name: Site Explorer: Map Organic Landscape and Competitors
playbooks.description: Sets up a Site Explorer project and runs a full organic landscape analysis covering keyword gaps, competitor positioning, and backlink profile.
playbooks.instruction:
Create a Site Explorer project and run a complete organic landscape analysis.

Step 1 — Create Site Explorer Project
Use list_site_explorers to check for existing projects. If none exists, use create_site_explorer with the user's domain. Wait for initial analysis to complete.

Step 2 — Organic Keyword Analysis
Use get_organic_keywords to pull the full keyword footprint. Identify:
- Total keywords ranking (any position)
- Keywords in positions 1-3, 4-10, 11-20
- Keywords with the highest traffic value
- Keywords where the user ranks but competitors rank higher

Use get_organic_pages to find the top-traffic pages. Confirm these align with the pages identified in the GSC analysis.

Step 3 — Competitor Discovery
Use get_organic_competitors to find the top organic search competitors. Select the top 5 and for each, note:
- Overlap score (how much keyword overlap exists)
- Their estimated traffic vs the user's traffic
- Keywords they rank for that the user does not

Present the competitive landscape to the user.

Step 4 — Backlink Profile Overview
Use get_site_backlinks to get the total backlink count and referring domains. Use referring_domains to see the quality and distribution of linking sites. Use anchor_text_analysis to check if anchor text is branded, exact-match, or diversified.

Highlight any toxic or suspicious links that may be hurting rankings.

Step 5 — Historical Trend
Use get_historical_trends to show organic traffic and ranking trends over the past 6-12 months. Identify any notable drops (algorithm updates, lost pages) or growth patterns.

Step 6 — Deliver the Intelligence Report
Present a competitor gap analysis showing:
- Top 10 keywords competitors rank for that the user doesn't (highest-value content opportunities)
- Pages to create or optimize based on competitor keyword gaps
- Backlink gap: domains linking to competitors but not to the user (link building targets)
expected_benefits: Maps the full competitive keyword landscape and identifies content gaps
Reveals which competitor pages and topics are driving their traffic
Provides a prioritized backlink target list for Day 3 link building playbooks
playbooks.sample_prompt: Set up a Site Explorer for my domain. Show me my organic keyword footprint, my top competitors, and the biggest content and backlink gaps I should target.

playbooks.name: Run a Full Site Audit
playbooks.description: Runs a comprehensive technical SEO audit via OTTO and delivers a prioritized fix list covering critical, high, and medium severity issues.
playbooks.instruction:
Run a full site audit and deliver a prioritized technical SEO fix list.

Step 1 — Verify OTTO Project
Use list_otto_projects to find the user's OTTO project. Use get_otto_project_details to confirm the project is active. Use verify_otto_installation to confirm the OTTO pixel is installed and tracking. If the pixel is not installed, use get_otto_installation_guide to walk the user through setup before proceeding.

Step 2 — Create the Audit
Use create_audit to start a full site crawl. This will crawl all pages and identify technical SEO issues. Note the audit ID for reference.

Step 3 — Retrieve Audit Results
Poll get_site_audit_by_id until the audit status is complete. Once complete, use get_project_issues_summary for a high-level issues overview.

Step 4 — Categorize Issues by Severity
Use get_website_issues_by_type to break down the full issue list. Organize findings by severity:

Critical (fix immediately):
- Broken internal links (404 errors)
- Redirect chains and loops
- Missing or duplicate title tags
- Pages blocked from indexation unintentionally
- Missing canonical tags

High Priority:
- Missing or duplicate meta descriptions
- Images without alt text
- Missing H1 tags or duplicate H1s
- Pages with thin content

Medium Priority:
- Schema markup gaps
- Heading hierarchy issues
- Page speed flags
- Suboptimal internal linking structure

Step 5 — Generate AI Recommendations
For the top 10 critical and high-priority pages, use generate_bulk_recommendations to create AI-powered fix suggestions. Present these to the user.

Step 6 — Prioritize and Plan
Deliver a structured fix plan:
1. Critical issues — must fix before any content work
2. Quick wins — can be auto-deployed via OTTO with one click
3. Content issues — feed into the content playbooks (Days 2-3)

Note: Deployment of fixes will be done in Day 2 Playbook 6 (Strengthen On-Page SEO). This playbook is for discovery and prioritization only.
expected_benefits: Uncovers technical SEO issues blocking rankings before content work begins
Produces a prioritized fix list so effort goes to the highest-impact issues first
Creates the audit baseline needed to measure technical SEO improvement on Day 5
playbooks.sample_prompt: Run a full site audit on my website. Show me all the technical SEO issues organized by severity and tell me which ones to fix first.

playbooks.name: AI-Optimized Industry Leader Listicle Builder
playbooks.description: Creates a neutral, evidence-based listicle that ranks the user's brand #1 while fairly comparing competitors.
playbooks.instruction:
Create a Best-Of listicle article that positions the user's brand as the #1 choice.

Step 1 — Competitor Research
Use get_organic_competitors to identify the top competitors in the user's space. Use ask_brand_vault to pull the user's brand strengths and unique selling points.

Step 2 — Define Evaluation Criteria
Establish 5-7 objective evaluation criteria relevant to the industry (e.g., features, pricing, customer support, ease of use, integrations). Present the criteria to the user for approval before proceeding.

Step 3 — Generate the Article
Use the content generation workflow to create the listicle:
1. create_content_instance with a title like "Best [Category] in [Year]: Top [N] Compared"
2. start_information_retrieval for the target keyword
3. start_headings_outline structured as: Introduction → Evaluation Methodology → #1 [User's Brand] → #2-N [Competitors] → Comparison Table → Verdict
4. generate_complete_article

The article MUST:
- Use consistent evaluation criteria across all entries
- Rank the user's brand #1 with factual justification
- Be fair and professional — no sales language or exaggeration
- Include a comparison table with ratings
- Cite real features, real pricing, and real capabilities

Step 4 — Quality and SEO
Run run_content_grader and aim for 80+ score. Use insert_article_links for internal linking. Use edit_article_content to refine any sections that need improvement.

Step 5 — Present for Review
Show the complete article to the user for final approval before publishing.
expected_benefits: Creates a neutral, evidence-based listicle ranking the brand #1
Fairly compares competitors using consistent evaluation criteria
Targets high-intent comparison keywords for organic traffic

playbooks.name: AI-Optimized Head-to-Head Content
playbooks.description: Builds a structured head-to-head comparison article showing why the user's brand is the better choice.
playbooks.instruction:
Create a head-to-head comparison article between the user's brand and a specific competitor.

Step 1 — Identify the Competitor
Ask the user which competitor they want to compare against. Use get_organic_competitors to validate the competitor's relevance. Use get_organic_keywords to find keywords where both brands compete.

Step 2 — Research Both Brands
Use ask_brand_vault to pull detailed information about the user's brand. Research the competitor through publicly available data from the SERP analysis.

Step 3 — Generate the Comparison Article
Use the content generation workflow:
1. create_content_instance with title: "[User Brand] vs [Competitor]: Honest Comparison [Year]"
2. start_information_retrieval for the "vs" keyword
3. start_headings_outline with structure: Overview → Feature-by-Feature Comparison (5-7 sections) → Pricing → Pros/Cons Table → Who Should Choose What → Final Verdict
4. generate_complete_article

The article MUST:
- Use factual side-by-side analysis
- Acknowledge competitor strengths honestly
- Clearly demonstrate where the user's brand wins
- Include structured comparison tables
- Avoid aggressive marketing language
- Use data and specific examples

Step 4 — Optimize
Run run_content_grader for SEO scoring. Use insert_article_links for internal links. Refine with edit_article_content as needed.

Step 5 — Present for Review
Show the complete article and get user approval.
expected_benefits: Builds a structured comparison showing why the brand is the better choice
Uses factual side-by-side analysis with honest competitor acknowledgment
Targets high-intent comparison and vs keywords

playbooks.name: AI Optimized About Us Page Creator
playbooks.description: Generates a factual, citation-backed company profile for About pages and brand authority content.
playbooks.instruction:
Generate a professional About Us page using verified Brand Vault data.

Step 1 — Pull Brand Data
Use retrieve_brand_vault_details to get the full Brand Vault. Use get_brand_vault_business_info for company details (name, address, founding, leadership). Use get_knowledge_graph for authorship data, social profiles, and top pages.

Step 2 — Generate the Company Profile
Use the content generation workflow to create the About Us page:
1. create_content_instance with title: "About [Company Name]"
2. start_information_retrieval for the brand name
3. start_headings_outline with structure: Company Overview → Mission & Values → History/Founding Story → Leadership Team → Products/Services → Achievements & Recognition → Contact Information
4. generate_complete_article

The article MUST:
- Use ONLY verified facts from the Brand Vault — never fabricate achievements, awards, or claims
- Be professional and authoritative without being promotional
- Include citation-worthy facts (founding date, team size, locations, certifications)
- Structure content for E-E-A-T (Experience, Expertise, Authoritativeness, Trustworthiness)
- Include schema-friendly data (organization name, address, founders)

Step 3 — Quality Check
Run run_content_grader. Verify every factual claim against Brand Vault data. Flag any content that cannot be verified.

Step 4 — Present for Review
Show the complete About Us page for user approval. Highlight any sections where additional information would strengthen the page.
expected_benefits: Generates a factual, citation-backed company profile using verified sources only
Structures content for E-E-A-T signals and schema markup
Creates brand authority content suitable for About pages

playbooks.name: AI-Optimized Industry Leader Content Creation
playbooks.description: Produces a professional editorial review highlighting a company's strengths and market position.
playbooks.instruction:
Create an industry leader editorial review article.

Step 1 — Research the Brand
Use ask_brand_vault to pull comprehensive brand data. Use get_brand_vault_business_info for company details. Use retrieve_brand_signal_score to assess the brand's current authority and credibility signals.

Step 2 — Generate the Editorial Review
Use the content generation workflow:
1. create_content_instance with a title like "[Company Name]: Industry Leader in [Category] — [Year] Review"
2. start_information_retrieval for the brand + category keyword
3. start_headings_outline with structure: Executive Summary → Company Background → Market Position → Key Strengths → Product/Service Analysis → Customer Impact → Industry Recognition → Final Assessment
4. generate_complete_article

The article MUST:
- Read like a professional editorial review, NOT a press release
- Highlight strengths with specific evidence and examples
- Discuss market position relative to the industry
- Maintain credibility — no exaggeration, no superlatives without evidence
- Include data points, metrics, and verifiable claims
- Use third-person perspective throughout

Step 3 — Add Authority Signals
Use insert_article_links to add internal and external links. Run run_content_grader and refine with edit_article_content to reach 80+ score.

Step 4 — Present for Review
Show the complete review for user approval.
expected_benefits: Produces a professional editorial review without sales language
Highlights company strengths with specific evidence
Positions the brand as an industry leader through authoritative content

playbooks.name: Automated GBP Review Response & Amplification Engine
playbooks.description: Sets up automated GBP posting, review responses, and ongoing optimization for local visibility.
playbooks.instruction:
Set up automated Google Business Profile management including review responses and weekly posting.

Step 1 — Connect and Verify GBP
Use list_locations to find the user's connected GBP locations. Use get_location to verify profile details are complete. Use get_location_stats to baseline current performance.

Step 2 — Review Response Automation
Use list_reviews to pull all existing reviews. For each unresponded review:
- Use ai_generate_review_reply to draft a personalized response
- Present drafts to the user for approval
- Use update_review_reply to save and publish_review_reply to post approved responses

Then configure ongoing automation:
- Use get_review_reply_automation_settings to check current config
- Use update_review_reply_automation_settings to enable automatic AI replies for future reviews
- Set appropriate tone and response guidelines

Step 3 — Weekly Posting Schedule
Use bulk_generate_posts to create a week's worth of GBP posts covering:
- Business updates and offers
- Service highlights
- Industry tips and local content
- Event announcements

Use bulk_create_posts to create them all. Present to user for review. Use approve_post and publish_post for approved content.

Step 4 — Enable Automated Posting
Use enable_automated_posting to turn on scheduled posting. Use update_automated_posting_settings to configure posting frequency (recommend 2-3 posts per week) and content types.

Step 5 — Report
Summarize what was set up: number of reviews responded to, posts scheduled, automation enabled. Provide the user with next steps for monitoring.
expected_benefits: Automates review responses to improve engagement and local trust
Establishes a consistent weekly GBP posting schedule
Improves local search visibility with minimal ongoing manual effort

playbooks.name: Gain Media Coverage and Brand Mentions
playbooks.description: Builds and distributes press releases on Tier 1 publisher networks targeting branded keywords.
playbooks.instruction:
Create and distribute a press release on Tier 1 publisher networks.

Step 1 — Gather Brand Data
Use ask_brand_vault to pull the user's brand information. Confirm the following are available in the Brand Vault:
- Author name
- Phone number
- Address
- Logo URL
- Website URL
- GBP URL (if local business)

If any are missing, prompt the user to provide them and use update_brand_vault_business_info to save.

Step 2 — Define Targeting
Ask the user for:
- Branded keywords to target (company name + service terms)
- The primary service offering to feature
- Any newsworthy angle (new product, milestone, expansion, partnership)

Step 3 — Generate Press Release Content
Use auto_generate_article to create the press release content. Structure it as:
- Headline with branded keyword
- Dateline and lead paragraph (who, what, when, where, why)
- Supporting details and quotes
- Boilerplate company description
- Contact information

Step 4 — Select Distribution
Use get_press_release_categories to find the right category for the content. Use get_press_release_distributions to show available Tier 1 distribution networks. Present options with pricing and reach to the user.

Step 5 — Publish
After user approves the content and selects a distribution network, use publish_press_release to distribute. Confirm submission and provide expected timeline for publication across the network.
expected_benefits: Places brand content on Tier 1 publisher networks
Builds brand mentions and backlinks from authoritative sources
Targets branded keywords for Google and AI search visibility

playbooks.name: Deploy Single Cloud Stack Authority Order
playbooks.description: Deploys low-cost backlinks on cloud service providers to build contextual authority.
playbooks.instruction:
Deploy a Cloud Stack authority order for low-cost backlink building.

Step 1 — Gather Targeting Data
Use get_brand_vault_business_info to pull the user's website URL, brand name, and GBP URL (if local). Ask the user for:
- 3-5 branded keywords (company name + service terms)
- 1-2 service offering keywords
- GBP link if they are a local business

Step 2 — Review Existing Links
Use list_wildfire_links to check what community/cloud links already exist for this project. Identify gaps and avoid duplicating existing deployments.

Step 3 — Deploy Cloud Stack
Use deploy_wildfire_link to create web properties on cloud service providers. Target the branded keywords and service offering keywords provided by the user. Include the GBP link in the deployment if this is a local business.

Step 4 — Verify Deployment
Use list_wildfire_backlinks to confirm the deployed backlinks are active and pointing to the correct target URLs. Present a summary showing:
- Number of links deployed
- Target keywords used
- Cloud platforms deployed to
- Links pointing to main site vs GBP

Step 5 — Report
Summarize the authority signals created and expected impact timeline (typically 2-4 weeks for indexation and authority flow).
expected_benefits: Creates contextual backlinks on cloud service provider platforms
Builds authority at low cost with branded anchor text
Supports local SEO with GBP link inclusion

playbooks.name: Deploy Link Labs Guest Post Campaign
playbooks.description: Places editorial guest posts on topically relevant publishers through the Link Lab marketplace.
playbooks.instruction:
Deploy a guest post campaign through the Link Lab publisher marketplace.

Step 1 — Define Campaign Goals
Ask the user for:
- Target keywords and topics
- Budget range for guest post placements
- Preferred publisher categories (industry, niche)
- Target URL(s) to build links to

Step 2 — Discover Publishers
Use list_categories to browse the 900+ publication categories and find relevant ones. Use list (publications) to browse the publisher catalog with filters:
- Filter by category/niche relevance
- Filter by Domain Authority (DA) range
- Filter by traffic levels
- Filter by price range within budget

Use get_details to review specific publishers' metrics, editorial guidelines, and turnaround times.

Step 3 — Present Publisher Shortlist
Show the user 5-10 recommended publishers with:
- Publisher name and URL
- DA, traffic, and relevance metrics
- Price per placement
- Editorial requirements

Wait for user approval before proceeding.

Step 4 — Create Guest Post Article
Use create_article to write the guest post content. The article should:
- Be topically relevant to the publisher's audience
- Naturally incorporate the target keyword and link
- Meet the publisher's editorial guidelines
- Be high-quality editorial content, not advertorial

Use validate_content to verify the article meets placement requirements.

Step 5 — Place the Order
Use add_to_cart for each approved publisher. Use view_cart to review the complete order. Use checkout_cart to submit.

Step 6 — Track Progress
Use list (orders) and get_details to monitor order status. Report expected publication timelines to the user.
expected_benefits: Places editorial guest posts on topically relevant publisher sites
Builds high-quality backlinks from real publishers with real traffic
Provides full control over anchor text and target URLs

playbooks.name: Create Local Directory Citations
playbooks.description: Submits the user's business to local directory aggregator networks for citation building.
playbooks.instruction:
Create local directory citations for the user's Google Business Profile.

Step 1 — Pull GBP Data
Use list_locations to find the user's GBP locations. Use get_location to get full business details (name, address, phone, categories, hours, website).

Step 2 — Preview Citation Data
Use preview_citation_data to see what data will be submitted to directory networks. Verify NAP (Name, Address, Phone) consistency. Use get_citation_business_categories to check available categories and select the best match.

Step 3 — Review Existing Citations
Use get_aggregator_networks to check if any citations have already been submitted. Identify which aggregator networks still need submissions.

Step 4 — Submit Citations
Use submit_citation to send the business data to aggregator networks. These networks distribute to hundreds of local directories (Yelp, YellowPages, Foursquare, etc.).

Step 5 — Verify and Report
Use get_aggregator_details to check submission status for each network. Use export_citation to create a CSV record. Use bulk_refresh_stats to update citation statistics.

Present a summary showing:
- Number of networks submitted to
- Expected directory coverage
- Timeline for listings to appear (typically 2-8 weeks)
- NAP data submitted
expected_benefits: Distributes business data to hundreds of local directories via aggregator networks
Builds NAP consistency across the local citation ecosystem
Improves local search rankings through citation signals
playbooks.sample_prompt: Create local directory citations for my GBP

playbooks.name: Strengthen On-Page SEO for Priority Pages
playbooks.description: Identifies and deploys on-page SEO fixes for titles, meta descriptions, headings, and schema on priority pages.
playbooks.instruction:
Complete all pending OTTO SEO deployments and strengthen on-page SEO for priority pages.

Step 1 — Project Status Check
Use list_otto_projects to find the user's OTTO project. Use get_otto_project_details for full status. Use verify_otto_installation to confirm the OTTO pixel is active. If not engaged, use engage_otto_project.

Step 2 — Audit Current Issues
Use get_project_issues_summary to get a comprehensive view of all SEO issues. Use get_website_issues_by_type to break down issues by category:
- Title tags (missing, duplicate, too long/short)
- Meta descriptions (missing, duplicate, suboptimal)
- Headings (missing H1, improper hierarchy)
- Schema markup (missing or incomplete)
- Technical issues (broken links, redirect chains)

Step 3 — Generate AI Recommendations
For the highest-priority pages, use generate_bulk_recommendations to create AI-powered fix suggestions. Use export_suggestions to review all recommendations.

Step 4 — Review and Edit
Present the recommendations to the user organized by priority. Use edit_suggestions_bulk to modify any suggestions the user wants to adjust before deploying.

Step 5 — Deploy Fixes
After user approval, use deploy_seo_fixes for each issue type. Deploy in this order:
1. Title tags
2. Meta descriptions
3. Heading structure
4. Schema markup (use generate_page_level_schema and deploy_page_level_schema for pages, deploy_domain_level_schema for site-wide)

Use get_otto_task_status to monitor async deployments.

Step 6 — Verify and Recrawl
Use trigger_recrawl to force a fresh crawl after deployments. Present a before/after summary of changes deployed.

If any deployment needs to be reversed, use rollback_seo_fixes.
expected_benefits: Optimizes titles, meta descriptions, and headings on priority pages
Deploys schema markup for improved rich snippets
Improves visibility, relevance, and click-through rates

playbooks.name: Publisher Prospecting Outreach Playbook
playbooks.description: Creates and launches a publisher outreach campaign for editorial backlinks and media mentions.
playbooks.instruction:
Build and launch a publisher prospecting outreach campaign for editorial backlinks.

Step 1 — Verify Email Connection
Use list_linked_emails to confirm the user has a connected email account. If none exists, direct them to connect one at https://dashboard.searchatlas.com/outreach/campaigns before proceeding.

Step 2 — Create the Campaign
Use list_projects to check existing outreach projects. Use create_campaign with:
- Campaign name based on the user's industry and goal
- Target keywords journalists and publishers would search for
- Campaign type: publisher/editorial outreach

Configure with update_settings:
- 20-25 emails per day maximum
- Weekdays only (Monday-Friday)
- Business hours sending (9 AM - 5 PM recipient timezone)
- 3-day gap between follow-ups

Step 3 — Discover Opportunities
Use list (opportunities) to find relevant publishers. Filter for:
- Industry blogs and niche publications
- News sites accepting contributed content
- Minimum DA/DR threshold
- Exclude .gov sites, Fortune 500 corporate sites, and PBNs

Present the top 10-15 opportunities with key metrics (DR/DA, traffic, relevance). Wait for explicit user approval.

Step 4 — Create Email Templates
Use create (templates) to build personalized outreach templates. Focus on value exchange:
- Offer quality content, expert insights, or story ideas
- Reference specific articles on the publisher's site
- Keep it professional and concise
- Include a clear call-to-action

Create 2-3 template variations for A/B testing. Show templates to user for approval.

Step 5 — Schedule and Launch
Use schedule_bulk to queue outreach to approved opportunities. Use toggle_campaign to activate the campaign only after user gives explicit confirmation.

NEVER activate a campaign without explicit user approval.

Step 6 — Monitor
Use monitor_inbox to check for replies. Use get_email_thread and reply_to_email to manage conversations. Use manage_sent_items to track unreplied outreach.
expected_benefits: Builds journalist and publisher outreach campaigns
Secures high-quality editorial backlinks and media mentions
Maintains sender reputation with conservative sending limits

playbooks.name: Business Prospecting Outreach Playbook
playbooks.description: Creates a cold outreach campaign targeting local businesses with industry-specific SEO and AI search messaging.
playbooks.instruction:
Build and launch a local business prospecting outreach campaign.

Step 1 — Verify Email Connection
Use list_linked_emails to confirm the user has a connected email account. If none exists, direct them to connect one at https://dashboard.searchatlas.com/outreach/campaigns.

Step 2 — Define Target Audience
Ask the user for:
- Target industries or business types
- Geographic area(s) to target
- Company size preferences
- The user's service offering to pitch

Step 3 — Create the Campaign
Use create_campaign with a descriptive name. Configure with update_campaign:
- Target industry and location parameters
- Cold outreach type
- Professional B2B messaging tone

Set sending limits with update_settings:
- 15-20 emails per day (conservative for cold outreach)
- Weekdays only
- Business hours

Step 4 — Discover Prospects
Use list (opportunities) to find local business prospects matching the criteria. Present prospects with available metrics.

Step 5 — Build Email Templates
Use create (templates) with industry-specific messaging:
- Open with a specific observation about their business (website issue, missing from AI search results, competitor gap)
- Present the value proposition clearly
- Focus on SEO and AI search visibility as the hook
- Keep emails short (150-200 words)
- Include social proof if available
- Clear CTA (book a call, reply, visit a demo)

Create 2-3 variations. Show to user for approval.

Step 6 — Launch
Use schedule_bulk to queue approved prospects. Activate with toggle_campaign only after explicit user approval.

Step 7 — Manage Responses
Use monitor_inbox for incoming replies. Use reply_to_email for follow-ups. Track pipeline with manage_sent_items.
expected_benefits: Turns local business lists into complete cold outreach campaigns
Uses industry-specific messaging focused on SEO and AI visibility
Manages the full outreach pipeline from discovery to response

playbooks.name: Launch an Agentic PPC Campaign
playbooks.description: Builds a complete Google Ads campaign from scratch using AI — business setup, product discovery, keyword clustering, ad content generation, and budget configuration — ready to send to Google Ads.
playbooks.instruction:
Build a complete Google Ads campaign using the PPC agentic workflow.

Step 1 — Business Setup
Use list_ppc_businesses to check for an existing PPC business profile. If none exists:
- Use generate_form_suggestions with the user's website URL to auto-populate business details via AI
- Review the suggestions with the user
- Use create_ppc_business to create the business profile

Step 2 — Product Discovery
Use discover_products to automatically identify the user's products and services from their website. Present the discovered products to the user. Use review_products to show the full list. Use bulk_approve_products to approve all relevant products.

Step 3 — Keyword Clustering
Use bulk_create_keyword_clusters to generate tightly themed keyword groups for each approved product. Present the clusters to the user organized by:
- Product/service category
- Match type distribution (exact, phrase, broad)
- Estimated search volume per cluster

Use bulk_approve_keyword_clusters to approve all clusters.

Step 4 — Ad Content Generation
Use bulk_create_ad_contents to generate responsive search ads for each keyword cluster. Each ad set should include:
- 10-15 headline variations (30 char max each)
- 4-6 description variations (90 char max each)
- Ad strength target: Excellent

Present all ad content to the user for review. Use bulk_approve_ad_contents after user approval.

Step 5 — Budget Configuration
Ask the user for:
- Daily budget per campaign (recommend starting with $20-50/day for testing)
- Bidding strategy (Maximize Conversions recommended for new campaigns)
- Geographic targeting
- Start date

Use bulk_create_campaign_budget to set budgets across all campaigns.

Step 6 — Final Review Before Launch
Present a complete campaign summary:
- Number of campaigns, ad groups, keyword clusters, and ads
- Estimated daily spend
- Bidding strategy
- Geographic targets

WARNING: Only use campaign → send_to_google_ads_account when the user gives explicit confirmation to launch. Never send to Google Ads without direct user approval.
expected_benefits: Builds a complete Google Ads campaign structure in minutes instead of hours
Generates tightly themed keyword clusters with AI-optimized ad copy
Applies the same brand voice and messaging from Brand Vault across all ad content
playbooks.sample_prompt: Build me a complete Google Ads campaign from scratch. Use my website to discover my products, generate keyword clusters, and write all the ad copy. I'll review everything before it goes live.

playbooks.name: Build PPC Landing Pages for Each Ad Campaign
playbooks.description: Creates dedicated, conversion-optimized landing pages for each PPC campaign using Website Studio's clone_ppc mode — matched to ad group themes for maximum Quality Score.
playbooks.instruction:
Create dedicated PPC landing pages matched to each ad campaign.

Step 1 — Map Campaigns to Landing Page Themes
Use list_ppc_businesses and list_campaigns_with_metrics to get the active campaigns created in Day 4 Playbook 1. Group campaigns by product/service theme. Each distinct theme will get its own landing page.

Identify the primary keyword for each theme — this becomes the landing page's headline and message match.

Step 2 — Create Landing Pages in clone_ppc Mode
For each campaign theme, use create_project in clone_ppc mode:
- Use the user's existing website as the source URL
- Set the target keyword as the page focus
- clone_ppc mode automatically:
  - Removes navigation (reduces exit paths)
  - Adds a prominent above-the-fold CTA
  - Optimizes headline to match the ad keyword
  - Adds trust signals (testimonials, badges, guarantees)
  - Removes footer links that distract from conversion

Wait for each project to generate before proceeding.

Step 3 — Review and Customize
Use get_website_studio_project to retrieve each generated page. Present previews to the user. For each page:
- Confirm headline matches the ad group's primary keyword
- Confirm CTA text and button placement
- Confirm contact form or conversion element is visible above the fold
- Confirm trust signals are relevant to the campaign theme

Step 4 — Publish
After user approves each page, use publish_project to make it live. Record the published URL for each landing page.

Step 5 — Connect URLs to Campaigns
Present the user with a mapping table:
| Campaign Theme | Keywords | Landing Page URL |
|---|---|---|

Instructions for the user: Update the Final URL in each Google Ads ad group to point to the corresponding landing page URL.

Step 6 — Quality Score Checklist
For each landing page, verify against Google's Quality Score factors:
- Keyword appears in headline
- Page load speed (recommend checking with PageSpeed Insights)
- Clear relevance between ad copy and landing page content
- Single conversion goal per page
- Mobile-optimized layout
expected_benefits: Creates dedicated landing pages for each ad campaign with keyword message match
Removes navigation and distractions to maximize conversion rate
Improves Google Ads Quality Score by aligning ad copy with landing page content
playbooks.sample_prompt: Create dedicated PPC landing pages for each of my Google Ads campaigns. Use clone_ppc mode so they're optimized for conversions. One page per campaign theme.

playbooks.name: GBP Post Campaign for Paid Traffic Amplification
playbooks.description: Creates and schedules a GBP post campaign aligned with the active PPC campaigns to reinforce brand messaging across paid and local channels simultaneously.
playbooks.instruction:
Create a GBP post campaign that amplifies the PPC campaigns running on Day 4.

Step 1 — Pull Active Campaign Themes
Review the PPC campaigns launched in Day 4 Playbook 1. Identify:
- Primary service/product being advertised
- Key offer or value proposition from the ads
- Target audience and geographic focus

Step 2 — Generate GBP Posts
Use bulk_generate_posts to create a set of GBP posts aligned with the PPC campaign themes. Each post should:
- Echo the same offer or message from the Google Ads
- Include a clear CTA that matches the ad (e.g., "Call now", "Get a free quote", "Book today")
- Link to the corresponding PPC landing page created in Day 4 Playbook 2
- Use keyword-rich language without being spammy

Generate 5-7 posts per active GBP location. Include a mix of:
- Offer posts (highlighting the promoted service)
- What's New posts (product/service updates)
- Event posts (if applicable)

Step 3 — Add AI-Generated Images
For key posts, use ai_generate_post_image to create on-brand visuals. Present images to the user for approval.

Step 4 — Review and Approve
Present all generated posts to the user. Use approve_post for each approved post.

Step 5 — Schedule and Publish
Use publish_post for immediate posts. Use bulk_create_posts with scheduled dates to stagger the remaining posts across the week — recommend 2 posts per day for maximum freshness signals.

Step 6 — Enable Ongoing Automation
Use enable_automated_posting and update_automated_posting_settings to maintain posting cadence after the challenge ends. Recommend 3 posts per week tied to the active PPC campaign themes.
expected_benefits: Reinforces PPC ad messaging in local search results simultaneously
Drives additional zero-cost clicks from GBP alongside paid traffic
Creates consistent cross-channel brand presence for users seeing both ads and local results
playbooks.sample_prompt: Create a GBP post campaign to amplify my Google Ads campaigns. Match the messaging from my ads and link to my PPC landing pages.

playbooks.name: Track Your Brand Across AI Search Engines
playbooks.description: Sets up LLM Visibility tracking and runs an initial brand scan across ChatGPT, Gemini, Perplexity, Copilot, and Grok to measure AI search presence.
playbooks.instruction:
Configure LLM Visibility tracking and run the first brand scan across AI search engines.

Step 1 — Check Existing Projects
Use list_llm_visibility_projects to see if a visibility project already exists. If one exists, use the existing project and skip project creation. If none exists, use create_llm_visibility_project with the user's website URL and brand name.

Step 2 — Add Brand Topics
Use add_topic for the user's primary industry categories and service areas. Recommended topics to add:
- Primary product/service category (e.g., "SEO software", "digital marketing tools")
- Brand name variations
- Core use cases

Use list_topics to confirm topics are registered.

Step 3 — Add Target Queries
Use add_query for the top questions potential customers ask AI engines. Examples:
- "What is the best [category] tool?"
- "How do I [solve core problem]?"
- "[Brand name] vs [top competitor]"
- "[Category] for [target audience]"

Add 5-10 high-intent queries. Use list_queries to confirm.

Step 4 — Run Brand Visibility Scan
Use get_brand_overview to retrieve the current visibility score across all AI engines. Use visibility_trend to see if visibility is improving or declining over recent periods.

Step 5 — Check Sentiment and Citations
Use get_sentiment_overview to understand how AI engines talk about the brand (positive, neutral, negative). Use get_citations_overview and citations_urls to see which pages are being cited when the brand appears in AI responses.

Step 6 — Simulate AI Queries
Use submit_prompts to send the top 3 queries directly to AI engines. Use get_prompt_analysis to review how the brand is mentioned (or not mentioned) in each AI response. Use get_ps_visibility to get the visibility percentage for each simulated prompt.

Present a complete AI visibility report covering: overall score, top cited pages, sentiment breakdown, and prompt-level visibility.
expected_benefits: Measures current brand visibility across ChatGPT, Gemini, Perplexity, Copilot, and Grok
Identifies which pages AI engines cite when mentioning the brand
Establishes a GEO baseline to measure improvement from Day 3 content and PR work
playbooks.sample_prompt: Set up LLM Visibility tracking for my brand and run a scan across all AI search engines. Show me where I appear and what's being said.

playbooks.name: Analyze Competitive AI Search Share of Voice
playbooks.description: Compares the user's AI search visibility against key competitors, identifies content gaps driving competitor mentions, and produces a GEO action plan.
playbooks.instruction:
Run a competitive AI search share of voice analysis and identify GEO content gaps.

Step 1 — Identify Competitors
Use get_organic_competitors from Site Explorer to find the top organic search competitors. Cross-reference with the user's known competitors. Select 3-5 primary competitors for AI visibility comparison.

Step 2 — Run Share of Voice Analysis
Use competitor_share_of_voice to compare the user's AI visibility against each competitor across the tracked topics and queries. For each competitor, note:
- Their visibility score vs the user's score
- Which topics they dominate
- Which AI engines favor them most

Step 3 — Identify Citation Gaps
Use citations_urls to see which pages competitors have cited by AI engines but the user does not. Use get_organic_pages from Site Explorer to understand the content types driving competitor visibility (blog posts, landing pages, comparison articles, etc.).

Step 4 — Analyze Competitor Content Patterns
For the top 2-3 most-cited competitor pages, note:
- Content format (listicle, guide, comparison, review)
- Topic angle and key claims
- Which AI engines cite them and for which queries

Step 5 — Build the GEO Action Plan
Produce a prioritized action plan with:
1. Content gaps — specific articles to create that could earn AI citations (map to Day 2 Content Genius playbooks)
2. Press release angles — newsworthy content that could appear in AI news queries (map to Day 3 press release playbook)
3. Brand mention opportunities — outreach targets where competitor mentions could be replaced (map to Day 3 digital PR playbook)
4. Quick wins — any existing pages that just need optimization to earn citations

Present the plan ranked by expected GEO impact.
expected_benefits: Reveals exactly which competitors dominate AI search and why
Identifies the content types earning AI citations in the user's niche
Produces a specific GEO content roadmap tied to the 5-day playbook actions
playbooks.sample_prompt: Analyze my AI search visibility compared to my top competitors. Find out who is winning in AI search and why, and give me an action plan to close the gap.

playbooks.name: Full 5-Day Results Review and Scale Plan
playbooks.description: Pulls performance data across all channels deployed during the 5-day challenge and produces a forward-looking 30-day scale plan.
playbooks.instruction:
Run a comprehensive 5-day results review across all channels and build a 30-day scale plan.

Step 1 — Local SEO Results
Use refresh_grid for all heatmap grids set up on Day 1. Use get_rank and get_heatmap_preview to get current rankings. Compare to the Day 1 baseline — show rank improvements per keyword and per grid point.

Step 2 — OTTO SEO Results
Use get_project_issues_summary to see remaining open issues vs the Day 3 baseline. Use get_website_issues_by_type to show how many title tags, meta descriptions, schema items, and headings have been fixed. Use audit_management to check if a new audit shows improved scores.

Step 3 — Content Performance
Use list_recent_articles to see all articles generated during the challenge. Use run_content_grader on any articles that haven't been graded yet. Use get_high_quality_articles to identify the best-performing pieces ready for promotion.

Step 4 — AI Visibility Progress
Use get_brand_overview to get the current LLM visibility score. Compare to the Day 5 Action 1 baseline. Use visibility_trend to show directional movement. Use get_citations_overview to see if new pages are now being cited.

Step 5 — Link Building Status
Use list_wildfire_backlinks to confirm Cloud Stack links are indexed and active. Use list (orders) from LinkLab to check guest post publication status. Use list_pending_outlinks from OTTO Wildfire to see queued internal link deployments.

Step 6 — Build the 30-Day Scale Plan
Based on results, produce a prioritized 30-day plan covering:
- Content: next 10 articles to create (from topical map gaps)
- Links: additional Cloud Stack, Link Lab, and Digital PR targets
- GBP: weekly posting schedule and review response cadence
- GEO: content to create based on competitive AI gap analysis
- PPC: whether to launch Google Ads (Day 4) based on organic baseline

Present the complete results report and 30-day roadmap to the user.
expected_benefits: Provides a complete before/after view of all 5-day challenge improvements
Identifies which channels showed the strongest early signals
Delivers a concrete 30-day roadmap to compound the 5-day gains
playbooks.sample_prompt: Run a complete review of everything we accomplished in the 5-day challenge. Show me the results across all channels and give me a 30-day plan to keep scaling.
